source.name: Question 4
source.instructions:
The following text is found in the file `/etc/bashrc`.
```bash
if [ "$(id -gn)" = "$(id -un)" -a "$(id -u)" -gt "99" ]; then
  umask 002
else
  umask 022
fi
```
Which of the following best describes the execution of this text?

answers.answer:
If the current user is a member of more than one group, then set the current shell's umask to
002, otherwise set it to 022.

If the current user's group name is the same as the user's username, or the user has a userid
greater than 99, set the shell's umask to 002, otherwise set it to 022.

If the user is a member of more than 99 groups, set the shell's umask to 002, otherwise set
it to 022.
If the current user is the root user, set current shell's umask to 002, otherwise set it to 022.

If the current user's group name is the same as the user's username, and the user has a userid
greater than 99, set the shell's umask to 002, otherwise set it to 022.
